page.title: 14HOP FARMING IN LYNSTED (3)
page.content: Normally the hops would run along the ground so special women train the hops up the string. The hop gardens near us are called Blacklands, Selby, & Upper & Lower Tickham. Around the edges of the hop gardens are poplar trees. Small flowers that have a beautiful smell grow, & birds nest & have babies there. If you look there are hundreds of different grasses and the stinging nettles are cut to fertilise the ground, & sometimes the flowers. People are strictly forbidden to walk through the hop gardens as they could kill the hops by spreading diseases. The Romans were the first people to bring hops to Britain. Kent has grown hops for hundreds of years. Hops are used to flavour beer.
